glsa.title: libxslt: Execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability was found in libxslt, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code and Denial of Service.

background.p: Libxslt is the XSLT C library developed for the GNOME project. XSLT itself is an XML language to define transformations for XML.

description.p: Anthony de Almeida Lopes reported a vulnerability in libxslt when handling XSL style-sheet files, which could be exploited to trigger the use of uninitialized memory, e.g. in a call to "free()".

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to process an XML file using a specially crafted XSL transformation file, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
